newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * Health Minister Iulian Mincu and Culture Minister Viorel Marginean told the state radio they had tendered their resignations for personal reasons. Their decision to quit was confirmed by Vacaroiu.

* Foreign Ministry spokesman Sorin Ducaru told a news conference President Ion Iliescu and government would organise next week a meeting with parliamentary parties to discuss the final text of the Romanian-Hungarian political treaty.
* Ducaru said both collective rights and autonomy on ethnic grounds had not been included in treaty due to be signed soon by the presidents of the two countries.
* Ducaru said all diplomats involved in politics or the electoral campaign should resign temporarily, in line with regulations forbidding diplomats to get involved in politics.
* Labour Minister Dan Mircea Popescu met prefects of counties where unemployement is high to discuss ways to solve the issue. He put the country's unemployement at 6.7 percent.

* Ivan Truter, deputy director of Council for National Minorities told a news conference the Council of Europe and the Romanian government would organise an international conference on "Governments for minorities" in Bucharest, September 10-11. --Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
